category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 41 (Management/action of occupational stress, etc.)
contents: Article 41 (Management/measures of job stress, etc.) ① If a worker performing the following tasks engages in work that involves high physical fatigue and mental stress due to emotional labor (hereinafter referred to as *job stress), the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall determine that the worker is suffering from job stress. To prevent health problems, measures must be taken in accordance with Article 669 of the Safety and Health Rules. Revised 2021. 12. 22., 2022. 12. 16., 1. Work requiring long working hours, 2. Shift work including night work, 3. Driving a vehicle. In this case, this applies only to full-time employment., ② The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall make efforts to ensure that the following workers receive medical and psychological treatment in the event of health problems such as trauma. Revised on December 16, 2022, 1. In case of assault, verbal abuse, or sexual harassment by a complainant, 2. In case of performing disaster accident investigation work
